revised_title: Lunar Influence on Barometric Mean in the Climate of London
tldr: The author, Luke Howard, studied the effect of the moon's position on the mean annual height of the barometer in London's climate. He discovered that the barometrical mean is depressed when the moon is in south declination and that there is a gradual depression as the moon moves from north declination to the equator. This suggests the existence of a large atmospheric tidal wave or swell caused by the moon's attraction. The study also found a cycle of 18 years in which the mean weight of the atmosphere increases and decreases.
